abstract.p: French investigators, reviewing possibility that kickbacks were paid by Elf Aquitaine for purchase of dilapidated East German oil refinery, issue arrest warrant for Dieter Holzer, suspect (S)

block.p: French investigators looking into the possibility that kickbacks were paid by the French oil company Elf Aquitaine for the purchase of a dilapidated oil refinery in the former East Germany have issued an international arrest warrant for Dieter Holzer, a businessman with links to German intelligence who is suspected of having paid millions of dollars in bribes. Mr. Holzer has admitted to receiving $23 million in ''commissions'' in the 1992 deal by Elf for a refinery in Leuna, in eastern Germany, but he denies paying any of the money as kickbacks. Elf has since been acquired by the French oil company Total.

French investigators looking into the possibility that kickbacks were paid by the French oil company Elf Aquitaine for the purchase of a dilapidated oil refinery in the former East Germany have issued an international arrest warrant for Dieter Holzer, a businessman with links to German intelligence who is suspected of having paid millions of dollars in bribes. Mr. Holzer has admitted to receiving $23 million in ''commissions'' in the 1992 deal by Elf for a refinery in Leuna, in eastern Germany, but he denies paying any of the money as kickbacks. Elf has since been acquired by the French oil company Total.
